snippet: Australia’s lower house of Parliament on Wednesday passed sweeping immigration reform aimed at deterring asylum seekers by reopening remote offshore detention centers.
abstract: Australia’s lower house of Parliament passes sweeping immigration reform aimed at deterring asylum seekers by reopening remote offshore detention centers that human rights groups have criticized as inhumane and possibly illegal; measure is a major reversal on the use of detention centers, which were largely abandoned when the Labor government of Prime Minister Julia Gillard came to power in 2007.
lead_paragraph: Australia’s lower house of Parliament on Wednesday passed sweeping immigration reform aimed at deterring asylum seekers by reopening remote offshore detention centers.

headline.seo: Immigration Reform in Australia Passes With Backing of Opposition
headline.main: Reversal on Immigration Policy in Australia
headline.print_headline: Reversal on Immigration Policy in Australia
